dialogues.speaker: SHARON
dialogues.text: (grinning) No shit. Join the frickin’ club. She rises, tosses the cigarette on the floor and squashes with her boot. She traverses the short distance to the ti window. Davey watches her while eating the other Twinkie. Sharon returns to the bench, holding a ticket. She hands to him. He takes it, speechless.

dialogues.speaker: SHARON
dialogues.text: You welcome. It’s good karma. (beat) Well? The last train leaves in five minutes.

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: I‘1l pay you back.

dialogues.speaker: SHARON
dialogues.text: Tell you what. Send it to my sister. She's in a foster home too. She takes out a pen from her bag.

dialogues.speaker: SHARON
dialogues.text: Give me that ticket.  41. He does -- reluctantly. She scribbles an address on it an gives it back, much to Davey’s relief.

dialogues.speaker: SHARON
dialogues.text: Good luck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Megan, in a summery cotton dress, gets out of the car and inspects the barely-readable address on this miserable- looking building, ironically named:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Megan studies the rusty mail boxes. She finds what she wants: “Danner. 202.”

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Megan carefully advances down the dreary hallway. She get to 202. It’s just a door with grease spots and yellow pol tape. What was she expecting to find anyway? Spent, she leans against the door; it narrowly opens. Someone forgot to lock up. She pushes the door in, exposi the squalid, filthy living room - only years of neglect c do this. She takes in the ruin of Laura and Davey’s life.

dialogues.speaker: MEGAN
dialogues.text: Jesus.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. BROWN, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: (British accent) I fancy they’re long gone. Startled, Megan turns. Mrs. Brown, the oddly formal Briti woman, frowns at her.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. BROWN
dialogues.text: The officers. They collected their evidence and left.

dialogues.speaker: MEGAN
dialogues.text: You knew them?

dialogues.speaker: MRS. BROWN
dialogues.text: Laura and Davey? I suppose so. You look a bit pale, deary.  42.

dialogues.speaker: MEGAN
dialogues.text: I could sit for a moment.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. BROWN
dialogues.text: Lovely. I‘11 fix us a cupper. INT. TOM & MEGAN’S HOUSE ~ LIVING ROOM - DAY Tom opens the door. It’s Otis.

dialogues.speaker: OTIS
dialogues.text: Hey, Tom. Sorry to disturb you at home. Can we talk? INT. TOM & MEGAN’S HOUSE - GARAGE - DAY Tom installs a piece of track. Otis, surprised, checks ou the model tracks. oTis I had no idea you were into model trains.

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: Something wrong with that, Romeo? oTis No, and I don’t need anybody's shit right now. Tom puts the tracks down. He goes to the door.

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: Let’s get out of here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Davey climbs up a slope speckled with tall weeds. Somethi moves behind him. He freezes, then quickly turns. Every tree and bush is ominous and sinister. A_lonely bird lands on a branch nearby. It watches him. H stares back.

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: (scaring the bird)

dialogues.speaker: AHHH
dialogues.text: It doesn’t move. He bends, picks up a small rock from the ground and throws it at the bird.  43. He misses by an inch, but the stubborn thing won't budge even flutter. A shiver runs down his spine. He looks around.

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: (whispering) Mom? The bird flies away. He shakes his head, dismissive, and continues up the incline. He settles on one spot and carefully sits, unraveling the pink pillowcase wrapped ar his hand. He flinches. The cloth has stuck to a deep, ope wound; it now removes pieces of his skin as it comes undo

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It’s a bit like a doll’s house with doilies and whatnots occupying every available corner. Megan, uneasy, is perch on the sofa. Mrs. Brown enters with a teapot and cups. Sh sits, puts a cup in front of Megan and takes one for hers

dialogues.speaker: MRS. BROWN
dialogues.text: We'll let it brew a while.

dialogues.speaker: MEGAN
dialogues.text: You're very kind.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. BROWN
dialogues.text: I've lived next door to Laura for five years. We were no bosom buddies, but you live next to someone for that long, you get to know them in an intimate way.

dialogues.speaker: MEGAN
dialogues.text: She ever mention suicide to you?

dialogues.speaker: MRS. BROWN
dialogues.text: You ARE a nosy one. Poking! Snooping! How did you find us? Who sent you!

dialogues.speaker: MEGAN
dialogues.text: Laura is listed. Call information if you don’t believe me.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. BROWN
dialogues.text: Oh, dear...dear...dear... (giggling) Trying times, indeed. Cookies?

dialogues.speaker: MEGAN
dialogues.text: No, thanks. Really.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But Mrs. Brown is already up and on her way to the kitche Megan is impatient...

dialogues.speaker: MEGAN
dialogues.text: (calling toward kitchen) You were saying, about Laura...

dialogues.speaker: MRS. BROWN, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: I looked after her son here and there. Bless her. Mrs. Brown returns, munching on butter cookies. She sets plate on the table. Megan smiles cordially.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. BROWN
dialogues.text: Couldn't help but notice all the men coming and going out of her apartment. Of course, no one’s been around in ages, but they used to flock to her like hungry birds.

dialogues.speaker: MEGAN
dialogues.text: They stopped coming?

dialogues.speaker: MRS. BROWN
dialogues.text: She had a breakdown. A nerves disease. Monstrous, isn’t it? The tricks our mind plays on us... Tea?

dialogues.speaker: MEGAN
dialogues.text: You think she wanted to die, then? Mrs. Brown pours imaginary tea from the pot. First in Megan’s cup, then in hers. Megan watches her, baffled.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. BROWN
dialogues.text: Hard to say, isn’t it? Maybe she did. Maybe she didn’t. (sipping imaginary tea) Quite good. Don’t be shy. Try it.

dialogues.speaker: MEGAN
dialogues.text: (beat) My cup is empty.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. BROWN
dialogues.text: Nonsense. Don’t be scared, Love. I made it me-self.

dialogues.speaker: MEGAN
dialogues.text: (rising) I should go.  45.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. BROWN
dialogues.text: You haven‘t had your tea!

dialogues.speaker: MEGAN
dialogues.text: ("sipping” her tea...) Mmmm... Very good.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. BROWN
dialogues.text: Lovely.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Davey looks up at a large sign:

dialogues.speaker: WELCOME TO UNION STATION, LOS ANGELES
dialogues.text: A cavernous marble hall with tall ornate ceilings, black marble floors and fabulous chandeliers. Davey furtively passes a tall ticket counter. The two CLERKS inside are b talking. He continues down to one door: “Authorized Personnel Only.”

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Davey makes his way down the marble hallway carefully examining the pictures that adorn the wall: Union Station the 30‘s and 40’s. N.B. comes out of one office with an ENGINEER. Davey hugs the wall.

dialogues.speaker: ENGINEER
dialogues.text: Tough break. Tom loves his train. They go into another office without noticing him. The doo closes behind them. Davey continues down to the--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Davey, holding his train, is face-to-face with a real, li docked train. He runs his fingers along one car. He sees ladder in the back and places his toy engine on the groun

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Davey gets to the end of the ladder. He looks down at the tangle of wires and steel connecting his car to the next He steps off the ladder and onto the roof, careful not to too much pressure on his injured right hand.  46. Slowly, he straightens himself and takes a few steps. It’ scary. From his vantage point he can see the gigantic sta building and more trains. Docked trains, resting like bea whales on their track. He continues to walk. Faster and faster. He stumbles, los his balance and almost slips off of the car. Determined, straightens up and looks ahead. He runs. He gets to the e of the car - jumps. He just makes it, landing hard on the adjacent car’s roof his body slamming against the cold, hard metal. Victoriou he rises and looks up at the dark sky.

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: I’m not scared of you! Do you hear me? I’M NOT SCARED!

dialogues.speaker: DAY
dialogues.text: Tom and Megan in the cotton dress.

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: What do you want? What do you want me to do?

dialogues.speaker: MEGAN
dialogues.text: What happened to us?

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: What are you talking about.

dialogues.speaker: MEGAN
dialogues.text: You heard me.

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: Meggie...

dialogues.speaker: MEGAN
dialogues.text: Don’t “Meggie” me. I’m not some fragile thing!

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: What do you want from me!

dialogues.speaker: CHILDREN
dialogues.text: He pulls over to the curb. They sit there a moment, tread on dangerous ground now.  47.

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: We didn’t find the right time.

dialogues.speaker: MEGAN
dialogues.text: You kept moving us around. Fourteen homes in fifteen years of marriage.

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: That's what trainmen do. They move with the trains.

dialogues.speaker: MEGAN
dialogues.text: Not all of them! It’s not a rule. It’s what we did. Who could have a child like that?

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: You got sick.

dialogues.speaker: MEGAN
dialogues.text: You're blaming me?

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: I‘'m not blaming anyone. It just happened that way. She absorbs his words, swallowing the lump in her throat.

dialogues.speaker: MEGAN
dialogues.text: I thought I had all this time. To be a woman, a nurse, a mother. Then I found out I didn’t. Things that weren’t urgent before suddenly took on a whole new meaning.

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: I was never sure I’d make a good father.

dialogues.speaker: MEGAN
dialogues.text: I’m not afraid to die but to think I haven't lived, that terrifies me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PASSENGERS board the train, passing a sign that reads:

dialogues.speaker: UNION STATION
dialogues.text: Vince, the engineer, heads to the locomotive.  48.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Davey, washing his face and hair in the small sink, tries make himself presentable. He's careful with his right han that has the nasty, deep cut. His clothes are filthy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Howie, in conductor's uniform, goes by. Davey exits the bathroom with his train and sees him. He follows.

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: You the conductor?

dialogues.speaker: HOWIE
dialogues.text: (turning) Yeah?

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: I’m looking for my Uncle Tom.

dialogues.speaker: HOWIE
dialogues.text: Never heard of him.

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: He drives this train.

dialogues.speaker: HOWIE
dialogues.text: You mean, Tom Stark? I didn’t know he had relatives.

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: He has a sister. I want to surprise him.

dialogues.speaker: HOWIE
dialogues.text: Sorry, Kid. Tom’s off duty because of the accident.

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: (playing dumb) The accident? A middle-aged MAN, a bit lost, hands Howie his ticket stu

dialogues.speaker: HOWIE
dialogues.text: (to Man) Two cars down. (to Davey) Tell you what, I’1l take you to Tom's place.  49.

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: Really?

dialogues.speaker: HOWIE
dialogues.text: Sure, catch a ride with us. Tom’s nephew is my nephew.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A working man’s joint. Country music plays in the b.g. TR DRIVERS wash down the road at the bar. Tom and Otis are a one table. ROSANNA, cheap highlights and expensive cleava serves Otis a coffee and puts a beer in front of Tom.

dialogues.speaker: ROSANNA
dialogues.text: Anything else?

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: We're good. She gives Tom a sultry smile and leaves.

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: I think she likes you. oTis Not my type.

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: I didn’t know you had a type.

dialogues.speaker: OTIS
dialogues.text: You thought about it?

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: About what? oTis The accident. I’m having a hard time with it.

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: Keep it to yourself. I don’t want to hear it.

dialogues.speaker: OTIS
dialogues.text: I’m going to talk to N.B. I’m giving my notice.

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: You do that now and you‘ll make it look like we did something wrong.  50. oTis But we did, Tom.

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: We didn’t have a choice, damn it. oTiIs We didn’t?

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: If we had put the train on emergency, the wheels would have flattened. We would have derailed.

dialogues.speaker: OTIS
dialogues.text: We'll never know for sure.

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: No. We won't. It was a judgment call, and I made it. (trying a different tact) Look, you don’t have it so bad. You’re good at what you do. You're barely thirty-five and you’re driving the Starlight. oTis And the guys hate me for it.

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: Screw them. (to BARTENDER; re: beer) Can I get another?

dialogues.speaker: OTIS
dialogues.text: We killed a human being - a person.

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: It was a suicide! oTis The homeless man was my first one - Victor Lopez. Tom shakes his head. A heavy weight on his shoulders. Rosanna puts another beer on the table, gives Tom another sultry smile and leaves.

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: (desperate) Why don’t we talk about something else. (MORE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TOM (cont'd) . Tell me, what's it like being a bachelor nowadays? You pick up the girls in accounting class? oTiIs It was right before the end of the shift. We had a smooth ride for ten hours. I was looking at the clock and thinking that we were making good time, might even be fifteen minutes early coming into LA. Then I see him. Standing on the tracks, gazing up at the sky, clear as day in the spotlight, and we blow the horn and ring the bell, but he ignores us.

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: They turn us into executioners.

dialogues.speaker: OTIS
dialogues.text: You know what he did right before we hit him? He smiled at us.

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: He had a death wish. Some people do. Other people don’t want to die and they die anyway. This wasn’t easy to say. He drinks. Otis pauses, then: He rises. oTis I‘ll wait until the hearing’s done. I'll give N.B. my notice then.

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: Fine. Do that. Otis does too.

dialogues.speaker: OTIS
dialogues.text: Don’t be an asshole.

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: I have no need for a quitter. He throws some money on the table. oTis Everything in your life is dying and you just can’t deal with it. Tom punches him. Hard. Otis falls to the floor. His glasses break.  52. He springs up and tries to hit Tom, but misses. Tom punch him in the stomach. Otis doubles over. Tom is ready to pounce on him when the very LA Bartender runs over with a golf club.

dialogues.speaker: BARTENDER
dialogues.text: Get out! Now!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A strip mall. Otis gets into his car. Tom is blinded by r

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: You talk about my wife again, I’1l kill you. oTis At least I’m alive. You’re already dead inside and everyone knows it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom, face distorted in rage and sorrow, rises from the fl and looks at his railroad. Shiny model trains sit on miniature tracks. He sends his fist into the tracks. CRASH!! Bits of plastic and metal go everywhere. A plasti “passenger” plunges to the floor. He turns to another section. CRASH!! The “mountain scener behind the tracks breaks in two. A yellow WESTERN PACIFIC model train tumbles down. Methodically he goes around the tracks breaking section after section. He stops to study destruction. The chaos that is his life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Megan closes a suitcase. She takes a last look around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Megan carries the suitcase down the stairs. The stark roo is empty except for open and closed moving boxes that are scattered throughout. She knows where to find her husband

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Megan enters with the suitcase. Tom sits on the floor margined by his broken railroad. She puts her suitcase do and takes in the ruin around them. He rises.  53.

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: I was scared of losing you because everyone I cared about left me.

dialogues.speaker: MEGAN
dialogues.text: It’s too late, Tom.

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: I thought if I didn’t get comfortable, if I kept us on the move and didn’t settle down it wouldn’t be so hard if you left me too. She goes to him and gives him a hug. Then:

dialogues.speaker: MEGAN
dialogues.text: Walk me to the door? He nods, choked-up, and takes her suitcase. They walk out INT. TOM & MEGAN’S HOUSE - LIVING ROOM - DAY Megan and Tom enter. He stops.

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: I can’t let you go.

dialogues.speaker: MEGAN
dialogues.text: Tom...

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: What’s going to happen when you get worse. Who’s going to take care of you there?

dialogues.speaker: MEGAN
dialogues.text: I’ll figure it out. A KNOCK. Tom puts down the suitcase, goes to open the doo Davey stands in the doorway clutching his train. Tom blanches and takes a step back. Davey advances into the house, staring at him with accusing eyes. Megan sees them.

dialogues.speaker: MEGAN
dialogues.text: Tom? Mad with anger and grief, Davey unleashes a barrage of punches on Tom.  54.

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: You didn’t stop! Shocked and helpless, Megan watches as Tom fends off Dave blows. She notices the boy’s bruised hand.

dialogues.speaker: MEGAN
dialogues.text: (to Tom) Don’t hurt him. Tom manages to pin Davey against the wall.

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: You had time! You didn’t stop!

dialogues.speaker: MEGAN
dialogues.text: Tom! Let him go. He does. Tom and Davey, at a stand off, glare at each oth

dialogues.speaker: MEGAN
dialogues.text: Why are you angry with Tom?

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: He killed my mother!

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: She killed herself.

dialogues.speaker: MEGAN
dialogues.text: (realization) Oh, God.

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: What were you doing? 60? 70?

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: I don’t owe you an explanation.

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: Yes, you do!

dialogues.speaker: MEGAN
dialogues.text: Tom. Please.  55.

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: (beat) My tail was on the curve.

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: That doesn’t matter.

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: It does! I was still making the turn!

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: How many cars?

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: Seven.

dialogues.speaker: MEGAN
dialogues.text: Show him the book.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Davey’s train is perched atop the table. Davey hovers ove Tom's tattered, thick Rule Book, reading intently. Tom watches him, tense. Davey looks up at him.

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: It doesn’t say.

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: (pointing to book) Right here. If you can picture a train going very fast--

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: You mean if it runs over 50 MPH.

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: Right. And the engineer decides to use the emergency brake instead of slowing it down, then--

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: There’s a 60% chance the train will derail. That’s what it says?

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: But that’s not for sure.  56.

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: It was a chance I couldn’t take.

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: Because your tail was on the turn?

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: And I had three hundred passengers. The train was packed. Davey pauses, conflicted between his love for trains and rage for Tom.

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: It almost always is.

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: It’s a popular route. Megan joins them at the table with an alcohol rub and a bandage. She cleans Davey’s wound expertly. He winces.

dialogues.speaker: MEGAN
dialogues.text: It will only hurt for a second. She quickly fans it with her hand to soothe his pain.

dialogues.speaker: MEGAN
dialogues.text: What do they call you?

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: Davey.

dialogues.speaker: MEGAN
dialogues.text: That’s a nice name.

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: How did you find me?

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: I went on the train.

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: What train?

dialogues.speaker: MEGAN
dialogues.text: Who’s taking care of you now?

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: No one.

dialogues.speaker: MEGAN
dialogues.text: Don’t you have any family?  57.

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: They put me in a foster home.

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: (to Megan) We should call the police. A KNOCK. They exchange tense glances.

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: If they're not here already. Shit! He rises. Davey looks at Megan, alarmed.

dialogues.speaker: MEGAN
dialogues.text: Don’t go anywhere. It'll be okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Megan and Tom, confused, stare at two husky WORKMEN. A large, covered object rests behind them. A truck is parke in the driveway.

dialogues.speaker: WORKMAN
dialogues.text: Megan Stark?

dialogues.speaker: MEGAN
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: WORKMAN
dialogues.text: We have your piano.

dialogues.speaker: MEGAN
dialogues.text: My...piano? (giddy with relief) Of course! My piano! He hands her an invoice. She happily takes it.

dialogues.speaker: WORKMAN
dialogues.text: Where do you want it? She points to a corner by some moving boxes.

dialogues.speaker: MEGAN
dialogues.text: There. Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: What piano?

dialogues.speaker: MEGAN
dialogues.text: I ordered it a few days ago.  58.

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: Oh. They watch as the men carry the piano inside.

dialogues.speaker: MEGAN
dialogues.text: What are we going to do?

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: Get him out of here.

dialogues.speaker: MEGAN
dialogues.text: Let him stay.

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: MEGAN
dialogues.text: Just for one day.

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: They’1l fire me. I can’t have contact with a victim's family.

dialogues.speaker: MEGAN
dialogues.text: Did you see his clothes? Did you see his face? His mother just died.

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: Someone must be looking for him.

dialogues.speaker: MEGAN
dialogues.text: Tom, if he’s leaving now, I'm going with him. She returns to the kitchen, leaving him to watch the work as they uncover a black, baby grand piano.

dialogues.speaker: WORKMAN
dialogues.text: Congratulations. It’s a nice one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Judy enters. Davey’s not around. She goes to the closet.

dialogues.speaker: JUDY
dialogues.text: Ready to say you're sorry? She opens the closet door. He's not there. Now she notice the shattered glass. The open window... She hurries out.  59.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Davey tries to eat his eggs politely, yet he’s so hungry can’t chew fast enough. Megan, sitting opposite him, smil

dialogues.speaker: MEGAN
dialogues.text: More?

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: No, thank you. Having scrubbed the plate clean, he rises, taking his dis to the sink. He opens the faucet. She watches him, surpri

dialogues.speaker: MEGAN
dialogues.text: What are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: Washing my dishes.

dialogues.speaker: MEGAN
dialogues.text: I'll do it.

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: I don’t mind.

dialogues.speaker: MEGAN
dialogues.text: It’'s okay. Really.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom, edgy, leafs through the newspaper on the couch. Mega enters. Davey follows cautiously. He is drawn to the pian

dialogues.speaker: MEGAN
dialogues.text: Do you play, Davey? He shakes his head “no.” Tom stares at him. Megan takes Davey out of the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Davey soaks in a bubble bath. His train is on the floor n to him. Megan opens the door slightly.

dialogues.speaker: MEGAN
dialogues.text: How are you doing in there?

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: Good, ma‘’am.  60.

dialogues.speaker: MEGAN
dialogues.text: Call me Megan. She puts some clothes on the floor and closes the door. H takes a sponge and scrubs himself. INT. TOM & MEGAN'S HOUSE - TOM’S OFFICE - DAY It's really the storage room. A few boxes are stacked on desk. Others are scattered throughout. Megan covers the futon with colorful sheets. Tom peers in the doorway.

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: Where is he?

dialogues.speaker: MEGAN
dialogues.text: Taking a bath. He's so polite.

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: Strange kid. Too grown-up. She pushes some boxes out of the way. He helps her.

dialogues.speaker: MEGAN
dialogues.text: You can’t imagine how he was raised. (off Tom's puzzled look) I went to see his home yesterday.

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: Whose home?

dialogues.speaker: MEGAN
dialogues.text: Davey and Laura's. In Simi Valley. She goes into one box, takes out pictures of Tom with ste engines and freight trains. He stares at her in disbelief

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: Why would you do that?

dialogues.speaker: MEGAN
dialogues.text: To find out if she really wanted to die.

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: She put her car on the tracks, didn’t she? Goddamnit, Megan!

dialogues.speaker: MEGAN
dialogues.text: It was important to me. A woman died, and you seemed to only care about your suspension... Tom, you should have seen their home. It was awful. Terrible. She places the train photos on the empty bookcase. He tak one and studies it in a gesture of reconciliation.

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: Where’d you find them?

dialogues.speaker: MEGAN
dialogues.text: They've been here. I think he’1l like them. Davey enters in one of Tom’s T-shirts. He holds his train and stands there, awkward. Megan smiles. Without the laye of dirt, Davey is a handsome boy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The wiry social worker is at her messy desk, on the phone

dialogues.speaker: RENEE
dialogues.text: (into phone) ++-I‘1l notify the police, Judy...Thanks. Aggravated, she slams the phone, digs in her drawer, take out a cigarette and lights it. She inhales, then:

dialogues.speaker: RENEE
dialogues.text: Crap. Since the desk doesn’t have an inch to spare, files are stacked on the worn carpet. She bends to the floor and fi a folder there: DAVID DANNER. INT. TOM & MEGAN’S HOUSE - LAUNDRY ROOM - DAY Megan puts Davey’s clothes in the washer and starts it. S picks up his sad, torn sneakers, wipes them clean. INT. TOM’S OFFICE - DAY The room is neater now. Davey studies a train photo just like Tom did. Megan enters with a mug of hot chocolate.  62.

dialogues.speaker: MEGAN
dialogues.text: We better put you in bed. Reluctantly, he goes to the futon.

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: No one sleeps in the daytime unless they’re sick.

dialogues.speaker: MEGAN
dialogues.text: Tom sleeps during the day.

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: He does?

dialogues.speaker: MEGAN
dialogues.text: If you don’t fall asleep, we‘ll think of something to do. He gets in bed, sitting up. She gives him the hot chocola He sips from it.

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: You're not gonna make me pray?

dialogues.speaker: MEGAN
dialogues.text: Pardon?

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: My mom liked me to pray a lot.

dialogues.speaker: MEGAN
dialogues.text: You can if you want to.

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: Not right now. She caresses his hair.

dialogues.speaker: MEGAN
dialogues.text: That’s alright. INT. TOM’S OFFICE - LATER Davey sleeps. Megan watches his every breath. Tom opens t door and peers in.

dialogues.speaker: MEGAN
dialogues.text: He's sleeping.  63. INT. TOM & MEGAN’S HOUSE - LIVING ROOM - DUSK Tom removes a stereo from one of the moving boxes. He installs it next to the TV. Megan takes out a tall vase f another box.

dialogues.speaker: MEGAN
dialogues.text: I guess we're staying a while.

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: I think we will. His eyes drift to her packed suitcase. It still sits by t door. A wordless understanding passes between them. She watches, as he carries her suitcase up the stairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spacious, clean, well-funded. POLICE OFFICERS chat, drink coffee and file reports. Crime is under control in Simi. Renee, anxious, cradling her own Styrofoam cup of coffee, sits with DETECTIVES ANN CRANE and CHRISTIAN FOX.

dialogues.speaker: RENEE
dialogues.text: Judy Neasy has been a foster parent for three years. She has an excellent reputation with us. Alright. She’s a disciplinarian. But I got him on such short notice, and I thought that after...well, after living with a psychotic mother, discipline might be good for him.

dialogues.speaker: ANN
dialogues.text: I'm sure you meant well.

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTIAN
dialogues.text: Do you have a picture? Renee opens her folder, takes out a school photo of Davey hands it to Christian.

dialogues.speaker: ANN
dialogues.text: We'll circulate it to our patrol units.

dialogues.speaker: RENEE
dialogues.text: You will find him, won't you?  64. Christian and Ann exchange glances.

dialogues.speaker: RENEE
dialogues.text: Maybe you could start with train stations. After the accident he was holding this little toy train--

dialogues.speaker: ANN
dialogues.text: Renee. May I call you Renee?

dialogues.speaker: RENEE
dialogues.text: Yes. Please.

dialogues.speaker: ANN
dialogues.text: In 2004 alone, over one hundred thousand children were reported missing in California. Most of them were runaways.

dialogues.speaker: RENEE
dialogues.text: I’m a social worker. You think I don’t know the statistics?

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTIAN
dialogues.text: Then you should realize chances are we'll never find him. Never. INT. TOM & MEGAN’S HOME - LIVING ROOM - NIGHT It’s starting to look like home. Megan, taking a break fr unpacking, sits at the piano. Tom, standing next to her, smiles encouragingly. She makes random sounds softly touching the keys.

dialogues.speaker: MEGAN
dialogues.text: I don’t want to wake him.

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: You won‘t. She caresses the keys with her fingers.

dialogues.speaker: MEGAN
dialogues.text: It’s so beautiful. He puts his arms around her full of yearning.

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: I’m glad you didn't...

dialogues.speaker: MEGAN
dialogues.text: I know. I know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INT. RENEE’S OFFICE - NIGHT Renee, eyes red, smokes a cigarette. Guilt-ridden, she st at Davey's photo lying on the desk. A JANITOR enters with vacuum cleaner. Renee rises.

dialogues.speaker: RENEE
dialogues.text: I was just leaving. Her eyes drift to Davey’s photo. Instead of leaving, she sighs and sits down again. The Janitor turns on the vacuu EXT. TOM & MEGAN’S HOME - TOM’S OFFICE - DAWN Megan sleeps on a chair opposite Davey - she’s obviously there all night. Tom, standing at the window, watches the August sun lazily make its way up the sky. He turns, meet her eyes.

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: Good morning. She smiles widely, glowing like a young girl again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom works on the tracks. Megan watches him.

dialogues.speaker: MEGAN
dialogues.text: I wish we could keep him.

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: You promised - one day.

dialogues.speaker: MEGAN
dialogues.text: He needs us.

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: We would be breaking the law. Isn’t it like kidnapping or something?

dialogues.speaker: MEGAN
dialogues.text: So?

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: So?! They won’t reinstate me if they find out he was here even for one day. (different tact) We could get in big trouble!  66.

dialogues.speaker: MEGAN
dialogues.text: I don’t care. I’m asking you to do this for me.

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: If I don’t work on the rails, I’m nothing.

dialogues.speaker: MEGAN
dialogues.text: You're my husband. INT. TOM & MEGAN’S HOME - KITCHEN - DAY Megan watches as Davey, in his now clean clothes, drowns eggs in ketchup.

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: I slept for almost a whole day. I was so tired, and I didn’t even know it. Where’s Tom?

dialogues.speaker: MEGAN
dialogues.text: Working on his railroad.

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: He’s got a railroad?

dialogues.speaker: MEGAN
dialogues.text: In the garage. You can join him when you're done.

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: (jumping up) I’m done.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Megan lets Davey in. Tom works on a broken track section.

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: Wow! He follows the tracks along the wall, not daring to touch them.

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: They're broken.

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: I'll fix ‘em in no time.

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: So big... Station houses and people and the tracks - they are so real.

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: Yes, well, I’ve been at it a while. (to Megan) You ready? INT. TOM & MEGAN’S HOME - KITCHEN - DAY With a trembling hand, Megan jots something down on a pie of paper. She folds it neatly and gives it to Davey.

dialogues.speaker: MEGAN
dialogues.text: That's our number. If you need anything, just call me, okay?

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: I don’t want to go back there.

dialogues.speaker: MEGAN
dialogues.text: You can’t stay. They won’t let us keep you.

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: Because of the accident?

dialogues.speaker: MEGAN
dialogues.text: Yes. She hugs him. Tom enters and watches her. She releases Davey, hurries o

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: Megan... She turns to him. There’s nothing he can say to make it better. She leaves. Davey turns to Tom. They go to the do EXT. TOM & MEGAN’S HOME - DAY Tom and Davey head to the car parked in the driveway. INT. TOM & MEGAN’S HOME - TOM’S OFFICE - DAY Megan, distraught, tears the linens off of the futon. she hears the CAR starting outside. She drops the sheets and goes to the window.  68.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Davey puts on his seat belt. Tom looks out the car window INT. TOM & MEGAN‘S HOME - TOM’S OFFICE - DAY Megan, at the window, watches as Tom pulls out the drivew

dialogues.speaker: DAY
dialogues.text: A NEIGHBOR, walking her dog on the sidewalk, blocks Tom’s way. Distracted, he brakes just in time and turns to Dave

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: Put your head down. Davey bends low in his seat. The Neighbor waves, while he dog relieves himself on the driveway. Tom waves back.

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: What are you afraid of?

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: Nothing. I don’t want anyone seeing you, is all. He turns to the boy - Davey clasps the scratched toy trai that’s sitting in his lap. It moves Tom. He looks at Dave INT. TOM & MEGAN’S HOME - TOM’S OFFICE - DAY Megan, at the window, takes a step back. She runs out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Megan runs in, sees Davey and Tom. One look at her husban face tells her everything she needs to know. She rushes i his arms, sobbing. He holds her. She wipes her tears, releases Tom and looks at Davey.

dialogues.speaker: MEGAN
dialogues.text: Everything is going to be alright now.  69.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A sign reads:

dialogues.speaker: WELCOME TO SIMI VALLEY
dialogues.text: Clean and lit, almost homey. PASSENGERS wait on benches. Renee tentatively hangs a flyer with Davey’s picture unde the heading:

dialogues.speaker: MISSING
dialogues.text: She looks around, expecting someone to reprimand her. No does. No one cares. INT. TOM & MEGAN’S HOME - KITCHEN - NIGHT Three plates are set on the table. Tom sits opposite Dave

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: When did you start driving trains?

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: Many years ago.

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: How old were you?

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: I don’t know. Maybe thirty.

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: I'll be ten in January. Megan, a bit anxious, sets a grilled chicken on the table Tom cuts the bird.

dialogues.speaker: MEGAN
dialogues.text: (to Davey) I hope you like chicken.

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: I do. (deliberate; to Tom) My_mom used to make it all the time. Tom, tense, pushes his chair back, rises.

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: Excuse me.  70. He leaves. Davey bites his lip and looks at Megan. She smiles compassionately.

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: You're not mad?

dialogues.speaker: MEGAN
dialogues.text: It's okay to miss your mother. INT. TOM & MEGAN’S HOME - TOM’S OFFICE - NIGHT Davey sleeps. Megan adjusts his blanket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom roughly handles the tracks. Megan enters.

dialogues.speaker: MEGAN
dialogues.text: He doesn’t know any better.

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: He did it on purpose. To spite me.

dialogues.speaker: MEGAN
dialogues.text: I’m taking the car. He turns to her. Concerned.

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: Where are you going?

dialogues.speaker: MEGAN
dialogues.text: To buy him some clothes. He can't keep wearing your T-shirts.

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: I’1l go. She looks at him, surprised.

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: Give me the keys already. You've been going nonstop.

dialogues.speaker: MEGAN
dialogues.text: Make sure to get everything. She hands him a list and hugs him.

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: What the hell are we doing?

dialogues.speaker: MEGAN
dialogues.text: I’m not sure, but I feel good. Better than I have in a long time. INT. TARGET STORE -— NIGHT Soft pop MUSIC plays as Tom meanders down the aisle with shopping cart. He stops at the boy’s clothing department. He takes a pair of boy’s jeans from the rack. He adds the to his cart then takes a few more pairs in varying sizes, just in case. INT. TOM & MEGAN'S HOME - TOM’S OFFICE - DAY The August sun bathes the room with light. Megan takes ou new clothes from “Target” bags. She gently folds one of t shirts, puts it in the dresser.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom works on his railroad. Davey watches him, clutching h toy locomotive. Tom turns. Davey looks away. Tom resumes working. Davey resumes staring. Tom sighs.

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: (relenting) Want to help?

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: Yeah. Tom hands him some “trees.”

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: You decide where your waiting passengers could use some shade. He goes back to fixing the rails. Davey puts his train as and approaches the tracks.

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: Careful. Davey nods and installs the “trees.”

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: What do you call your railroad?

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: The Stark Special.

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: Good name for a train.

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: I like to think so. (re: Davey’s train) Nice engine you got there.

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: My mom gave it to me. (lying) She was like Megan. She cooked a lot and cleaned and helped me with homework every day.

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: Yeah. I’m sure she was Mother of the Year. We’re done here. He puts down the tracks. Davey, upset, runs out.

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: Shit. He exits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Renee, with a stack of “Davey” flyers, hurries to the doo Her supervisor, AARON, enters. He sees her and stops.

dialogues.speaker: AARON
dialogues.text: I thought you had a hearing this morning.

dialogues.speaker: RENEE
dialogues.text: Yes, well, I asked Richard to cover for me.

dialogues.speaker: AARON
dialogues.text: (seeing flyers) What are these?

dialogues.speaker: RENEE
dialogues.text: Flyers.

dialogues.speaker: AARON
dialogues.text: I know what they are, Renee. What I don’t know is what you’re doing with them.  73.

dialogues.speaker: RENEE
dialogues.text: Going to trains stations.

dialogues.speaker: AARON
dialogues.text: Come again? INT. TOM & MEGAN’S HOME - LIVING ROOM - NIGHT Megan and Davey, in his new clothes, eagerly sit next to thin, seriously perspiring PIANO TEACHER. He takes out so sheets of music and sets them.

dialogues.speaker: MEGAN
dialogues.text: That won't be necessary.

dialogues.speaker: PIANO TEACHER
dialogues.text: No?

dialogues.speaker: MEGAN
dialogues.text: I want you to teach me one tune. Something...simple. He thinks a moment and plays a haunting piece by Badarzew

dialogues.speaker: MEGAN
dialogues.text: (moved) What do you call it?

dialogues.speaker: PIANO TEACHER
dialogues.text: “The Maiden’s Prayer.” INT. DEPARTMENT OF CHILD SERVICES - AARON’S OFFICE - DAY Folders are neatly stacked on the spotless desk. Renee si opposite Aaron. A citation for excellency proudly hangs directly behind him: “AARON LAPIDOS - FOR A DECADE OF DEDICATED SERVICE.”

dialogues.speaker: AARON
dialogues.text: Now and then we make bad calls. What's important to remember is that we did our best under difficult circumstances.

dialogues.speaker: RENEE
dialogues.text: I completely agree, but--

dialogues.speaker: AARON
dialogues.text: To say the boy had a troubled history would be an understatement. (MORE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: AARON (cont'd) He probably wouldn’t have made it with any family. Any. His flight wasn’t surprising. It was inevitable. Are we clear?

dialogues.speaker: RENEE
dialogues.text: Very.

dialogues.speaker: DAY
dialogues.text: Tom drives. Megan is next to him. Davey sits in the back.

dialogues.speaker: MEGAN
dialogues.text: You've really never seen one?

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: They don’t have them in Simi.

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: They’re large, blue and wet.

dialogues.speaker: MEGAN
dialogues.text: (glib; to Tom) You’re such a poet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The hazy orange sun, hidden behind distant summer clouds, diminishes as it dips into the ocean. Davey, barefoot, ki the water. He turns to Megan and Tom, big smile on his fa and runs along the shore, hopping and jumping on the surf Tom turns to Megan. She looks pale.

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: You alright? She nods. He puts a tentative arm around her shoulders.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A busy joint on the Venice boardwalk. Megan and Tom, drinking sodas, and Davey, eating chocolate ice cream, si large windows overlooking the ROLLERBLADERS outside as th zoom by. A BAND plays on a small dais. A wedding party, BRIDE and GROOM in tow, enter the coffee shop happy, young and carefree. Some buy ice cream. Some sit. The Bride, barefoot, and Groom, in sandals, get on t dance floor.  75. In their honor, the Band plays a sweet, slow tune. Megan turns to Tom. One look, and they rise and go to the dance floor. Davey, eating his ice cream, watches with a shy sm Megan whispers something in Tom’s ear. He returns to the table and sits. Megan gestures to Davey.

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: Never keep a lady waiting. Davey hesitates, then rises and goes to Megan. She dances with him. Tom eats Davey’s ice cream.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Renee parks her van at the curb, tosses her cigarette but out the window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dirty and under-funded. Busy POLICE OFFICERS work at cram desks. Renee sheepishly pins a “Davey” flyer on one wall. A wall already crowded with dozens and dozens of missing young faces that assemble in a heartbreaking collage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom and Megan sleep. Davey stands in the doorway, watchin them. Megan opens her eyes. Startled, she sits up. Davey backs out. She rises.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Davey sits on the floor rocking to and fro. Megan approac

dialogues.speaker: MEGAN
dialogues.text: Davey? You need something? He shakes his head.

dialogues.speaker: MEGAN
dialogues.text: Come on. Let’s get you back in bed. INT. TOM’S OFFICE - NIGHT Megan tucks Davey in.  76.

dialogues.speaker: MEGAN
dialogues.text: You want to talk about it? (beat) Was it a bad dream?

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: I was pretending.

dialogues.speaker: MEGAN
dialogues.text: Pretending what?

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: That you’re my mother, and we were like a family. I told Tom my mom was like you. That she cooked and helped me with homework, but she didn’t. Not in a long time.

dialogues.speaker: MEGAN
dialogues.text: I’m sure she did her best for you.

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: She tried real hard.

dialogues.speaker: MEGAN
dialogues.text: I know. Go to sleep now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Megan, exhausted, takes off her robe. She gets in bed. To turns to her.

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: Everything okay? She buries her head in his chest. He strokes her hair. Sh hugs him tightly. INT. TOM’S OFFICE - NIGHT Davey gets out of bed, holding his train. He goes to the bookcase and carefully positions it on top.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sign on the front window announces: “BACK TO SCHOOL SALE.” Megan exits with a large bag.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Megan gets in, puts the bag on the passenger seat. She starts the car, then digs in the bag and takes out childr books. She leafs through them. INT. TOM & MEGAN'S HOME - DAVEY’S ROOM - DAY Tom and Davey paint the walls blue in Tom's office. It’s officially Davey’s room. Tom notices Davey’s engine on th bookcase. Davey follows his gaze.

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: My dad asked my mom to give it to me for Christmas when I was six. He must have really liked trains. (beat) Did your father like trains?

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: I never knew him.

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: I didn’t know mine either. Tom takes that in. Davey dips his brush in black and pain a shape over the blue. Tom quizzically watches him.

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: It's a bird.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom watches Megan and Davey play “Chopsticks” together. Davey POUNDS the keys hard. Megan does the same - even harder. Davey laughs. Tom smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Megan enters. A single rose lies on her pillow. She goes the bed and takes it. Tom enters from the bathroom, his h combed back. He strikes a pose at the door. She laughs.

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: Sexy stuff, huh?

dialogues.speaker: MEGAN
dialogues.text: Irresistible.  78. He goes to the bed, collects her in his arms.

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: I want to be your man.

dialogues.speaker: MEGAN
dialogues.text: Silly. You are my man.

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: Will you be my woman? He takes an elongated box from the night stand and hands to her. She opens it. A delicate necklace lies inside.

dialogues.speaker: MEGAN
dialogues.text: Tom! We can't afford this.

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: Repeat after me: Happy...

dialogues.speaker: MEGAN
dialogues.text: (smiling) Happy.

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: Anniversary.

dialogues.speaker: MEGAN
dialogues.text: Anniversary... The years went by so fast, yet certain moments are so clear in my mind.

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: The first time you talked to me at the diner. He gently lays her down. He kisses her, passionately.

dialogues.speaker: MEGAN
dialogues.text: Our first train ride. You remember?

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: Every detail. I love you so much, my Meggie. He unbuttons her blouse. They kiss. His fingers study her body carefully, like a man discovering virgin land. EXT. TOM & MEGAN’S HOME - DAWN Sunrays dry the morning dew from the impatiens.  79. INT. TOM & MEGAN’S HOME - KITCHEN - DAY Megan listens, as Davey reads from Jack London's, The Cal the Wild.

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: (reading) “,..instincts long dead became alive again...” (to Megan) What are, “instincts”?

dialogues.speaker: MEGAN
dialogues.text: A feeling you get in your stomach when something is right or wrong. Tom enters with the mail. He goes through the envelopes a opens an official-looking one from the National Transportation Safety Board.

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: (showing off for Tom) “,..The domesticated generations fell from him...” But he stops reading, noticing that Megan is studying Tom face as he scans the official-looking letter.

dialogues.speaker: MEGAN
dialogues.text: What is it?

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: I have five days. Upset, he leaves the letter on the table and...

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: I‘1l be in the garage. He exits. Megan takes the letter, looks it over.

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: Five days for what?

dialogues.speaker: MEGAN
dialogues.text: Tom’s hearing. To decide if he did the right thing in the accident.

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: What if they decide he didn’t do the right thing?  BO.

dialogues.speaker: MEGAN
dialogues.text: Then he won’t be an engineer anymore. That’s okay. Tom’s capable. He can do many things.

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: There’s nothing like driving a train. INT. TOM & MEGAN’S HOME - GARAGE - DAY Tom and Davey work on the railroad. The broken tracks hav been mended. The “scenic scenery” behind the tracks is coming together. Davey picks up a model steam engine.

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: What do you call this one?

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: It’s real nice.

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: Uh-huh. Davey carefully puts it down and goes back to installing “mountain” behind the tracks.

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: I could tell ‘em she wanted to die. Tom turns to him, perplexed.

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: Huh?

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: I could say that at your trial.

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: It’s a hearing and, no, that’s alright.

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: You don’t want me to tell ‘em?

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: It doesn’t matter if your mother wanted to die, what matters is if I handled the situation correctly.  81.

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: (beat) I forgive you.

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: Forgive me, for what? She took away my options, when she put her car in front of me.

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: Yes, she did.

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: It just so happened that she chose my train.

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: Yes, I know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A sign reads:

dialogues.speaker: WELCOME TO UNION STATION, LOS ANGELES
dialogues.text: A cavernous marble hall with tall ornate ceilings, black marble floors and fabulous chandeliers. Renee walks past PASSENGERS waiting for their train or loved-ones.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vending machines, chairs, tables. ENGINEERS, STEWARDS and other TRAIN EMPLOYEES eat, read the paper and gossip. Ren hangs a flyer on the wall. She looks around. Everyone pre much ignores her. Howie, the conductor, and Vince, the engineer, enter. How brightening up, checks out Renee. He and Vince exchange glances: Fresh meat! They approach.

dialogues.speaker: HOWIE
dialogues.text: What’s a pretty girl like you doing in a train station all alone? She hands them a flyer. Vince takes it, pretending to stu the photo.

dialogues.speaker: RENEE
dialogues.text: I’m looking for a missing boy. Maybe you've seen him?  82.

dialogues.speaker: VINCE
dialogues.text: (teasing) Oh, yeah. We saw him. When’d we see him, Howie?

dialogues.speaker: HOWIE
dialogues.text: (glancing at flyer) Oh, he just left... She’s not stupid. She snatches the flyer away from Vince.

dialogues.speaker: RENEE
dialogues.text: (sarcastic) Thanks a lot.

dialogues.speaker: VINCE
dialogues.text: Sure... The smile leaves Howie’s face. He reaches for the flyer.

dialogues.speaker: HOWIE
dialogues.text: Give me that. He looks closely at Davey’s photo. She watches him.

dialogues.speaker: HOWIE
dialogues.text: It’s Tom's nephew.

dialogues.speaker: RENEE
dialogues.text: Who's Tom?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The neighborhood is eerily quiet. Tom and Megan take a wa

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: He said he forgave me for killing his mother. It used to be so simple. There was the right thing to do and the wrong thing to do. I mean, we're talking about trains. It’s mechanics. There shouldn't be a gray area.

dialogues.speaker: MEGAN
dialogues.text: Life is a gray area.

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: Not always. Some things you know with certainty. He looks in her eyes, kisses her.  83. INT. TOM & MEGAN'S HOME - DAVEY’S ROOM - NIGHT Megan tucks Davey in.

dialogues.speaker: MEGAN
dialogues.text: Good night, sleep tight, don’t let Davey out of my sight... She tickles him. He giggles.

dialogues.speaker: MEGAN
dialogues.text: That's my prayer. You like it?

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: It’s good, but you’re supposed to say “amen” at the end.

dialogues.speaker: MEGAN
dialogues.text: (serious; clearing throat) Amen.

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: Megan? I‘ve been meaning to talk to you about something.

dialogues.speaker: MEGAN
dialogues.text: Shoot.

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: This girl bought my train ticket to LA, and I promised I’d give her the money back. It’s ten dollars. Megan, touched, is speechless. Davey misreads her express

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: I'll work for it. Clean the yard, do the dishes, whatever you need.

dialogues.speaker: MEGAN
dialogues.text: I’ll go get it.

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: Wait. He rises and takes his train. He fishes out the ticket st from the toy engine, and gives it to Megan. The address Sharon jotted is on the back.

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: Send it here. It’s for her sister. She's in a foster home too.

dialogues.speaker: MEGAN
dialogues.text: I’ll do it first thing tomorrow. He puts the train back on the bookcase and gets back in b She kneels next to him and kisses his forehead.

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: (clasping hands in prayer) God, dear God, take care of my mom, her name is Laura Danner, and she sleeps a lot and drinks a lot, but she’s really a good woman, and she likes You very much. Amen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Megan closes Davey’s door and wipes away tears. EXT. TOM & MEGAN’S HOME - DAWN Sunrays dry the morning dew from the impatiens. INT. TOM & MEGAN’S HOME - LIVING ROOM - DAY Tom and Davey watch as Megan practices “The Maiden's Pray Suddenly, she stops and doubles over. Tom rushes to her side. He helps her up and walks with her to the stairs.

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: What's wrong?

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: Nothing. She’s fine. INT. TOM & MEGAN’S HOME - BATHROOM - DAY Megan throws up violently in the toilet. Tom wipes her fa with his hand. She sits for a moment, then throws up agai INT. TOM & MEGAN’S HOME - BEDROOOM - DAY Megan and Tom lie tangled in each others arms. He caresse her wet, sweaty hair and pulls her to him. Davey sheepishly enters.

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: There’s someone outside.  85. Tom rises, looks out the bedroom window: Renee’s van is parked outside. He can see the red sticker.

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: Shit!

dialogues.speaker: MEGAN
dialogues.text: Tom! Watch your language.

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: Department of Children and Family Services. At our door.

dialogues.speaker: MEGAN
dialogues.text: Goddamnit. INT. TOM & MEGAN’S HOME - DAY Tom opens the door for Renee.

dialogues.speaker: RENEE
dialogues.text: Tom Stark?

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: Yeah?

dialogues.speaker: RENEE
dialogues.text: I’m Renee. From Ventura Children and Family Services. We didn’t actually meet, but I remember seeing you at the scene of the accident. (beat) Can I come in? Tom opens the door wide. Renee enters. INT. TOM & MEGAN’S HOME - STAIRWAY Davey, eavesdropping from the stairs, makes a fist.

dialogues.speaker: RENEE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Thank you. What a lovely home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Megan slowly rises from the bed. Every move hurts. She pu on a robe, takes a deep breath.  86.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom and Renee are seated. Tom returns a “Davey” flyer.

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: I know who he is.

dialogues.speaker: RENEE
dialogues.text: You haven’t seen him since the accident? He avoids her eyes.

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: No. She notices Jack London's, The Call of the Wild. She pick it up and opens it.

dialogues.speaker: RENEE
dialogues.text: Great book. Do you have Children, Mr. Stark?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Davey, panicked, turns to Megan. She’s right behind him.

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: (whispering) I forgot my book!

dialogues.speaker: MEGAN
dialogues.text: (whispering) Take my hand. He does. She leads him to her bedroom.

dialogues.speaker: TOM, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: It’s my wife's.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He’s defensive, and Renee senses it. She rises.

dialogues.speaker: RENEE
dialogues.text: Would you terribly mind if I look around?  87.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Megan and Davey enter. He turns to her:

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: It’s the woman who put me in that foster home!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Renee heads up the stairs to the second floor. Tom follow

dialogues.speaker: RENEE
dialogues.text: He ran away from his foster home.

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: What’s it to me?

dialogues.speaker: RENEE
dialogues.text: Mr. Howie Pugh? The train conductor? He told me David was on the train, looking for you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They reach the top of the stairs.

dialogues.speaker: RENEE
dialogues.text: He claimed to be your nephew.

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: My nephew?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Megan and Davey can hear the approaching footsteps. She desperately looks around, then:

dialogues.speaker: MEGAN
dialogues.text: Under the bed!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Renee looks at Davey’s room / Tom's office.

dialogues.speaker: RENEE
dialogues.text: Do you mind?  88.

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: Sure I do. This is my home.

dialogues.speaker: RENEE
dialogues.text: I'm sorry. It’s a terrible imposition. Nonetheless, she looks inside... INT. DAVEY’S ROOM Davey is a neat boy, as no clothes are lying around. Rene take a quick inventory from the door: Train pictures, blu walls, sheets on the futon...Victorious, she sees Davey's engine on top of the bookcase just when:

dialogues.speaker: MEGAN, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Tom? What’s going on? She turns to--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Megan, in her robe, is at the end of the hall. She closes the bedroom door behind her and takes a few steps down to Renee and a tortured Tom.

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: (to Renee) My wife. Megan.

dialogues.speaker: RENEE
dialogues.text: Sorry to barge in like this. I'm looking for a missing boy.

dialogues.speaker: MEGAN
dialogues.text: Oh?

dialogues.speaker: RENEE
dialogues.text: (re: Davey’s room) I couldn’t help notice that the bed in this room is made and the walls are freshly painted. Megan, shivering, leans against the wall. Tom, genuinely alarmed, goes to her. Renee, curious, studies Megan.

dialogues.speaker: RENEE
dialogues.text: Are you okay? Megan nods.  89.

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: She's sick.

dialogues.speaker: MEGAN
dialogues.text: I have metastatic cancer. In my case it means the cancer has spread to my bones. Renee is shocked. Megan's short hair, pale skin, thin fra take on a whole new meaning...

dialogues.speaker: MEGAN
dialogues.text: I have trouble sleeping at night. And when I do, I go into the spare room. I don’t like disturbing my husband. As for the walls, blue always cheered me up.

dialogues.speaker: RENEE
dialogues.text: I'm sorry.

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: (pointedly) You said that already.

dialogues.speaker: MEGAN
dialogues.text: (to Renee; re: main bedroom) Want to look inside? Renee, torn, looks at Davey’s room then back at Tom and Megan. She shakes her head.

dialogues.speaker: RENEE
dialogues.text: No. That’s okay. (to Megan) I hope you feel better. She turns and leaves quickly, going down the stairs. SLAM Megan and Tom hear the door closing behind her. The bedro door opens. Davey peers out.

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: She’s gone, Kid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Renee reaches for her cigarettes, then crumples the pack tosses it in the passenger's footwell. She digs in her ba finds a business card and her cell. She dials.  90.

dialogues.speaker: POLICE DISPATCHER, (V.0O.)
dialogues.text: Simi Valley Police...Hello... Hello?...Anyone There? Renee hangs up. She looks out at Tom and Megan’s house. S starts the car. INT. TOM & MEGAN’S HOME - BEDROOM - DAY Megan, in bed, holds a thermometer in her mouth. Tom take it out and checks it.

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: still high.

dialogues.speaker: MEGAN
dialogues.text: We should tell him I’m sick.

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: Not yet. He’s not ready.

dialogues.speaker: MEGAN
dialogues.text: I’ll call Susan. She can make dinner.

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: Don't worry about dinner!

dialogues.speaker: MEGAN
dialogues.text: Tom...

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: MEGAN
dialogues.text: It’s going to be okay. He lays his head on her chest. She picks up the phone, di

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Susan cooks dinner while intently glancing at Davey and T who sit at the kitchen table.

dialogues.speaker: SUSAN
dialogues.text: (re: pot on stove) Almost done.  91.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Susan administers cold compresses to Megan’s burning forehead. Tom, worried sick, stands by the bed. Susan loo at Megan and then back at Tom.

dialogues.speaker: SUSAN
dialogues.text: This is the single craziest thing I've ever heard.

dialogues.speaker: MEGAN
dialogues.text: We know.

dialogues.speaker: SUSAN
dialogues.text: I mean, really.

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: Yes. It's pretty bad. INT. DEPARTMENT OF CHILD SERVICES - RENEE’S OFFICE - NIGH Renee trashes the flyers in the waste basket. She takes Davey’s folder from her desk. She opens a cluttered drawe puts the file in. The Janitor enters. She shuts the drawe

dialogues.speaker: RENEE
dialogues.text: I was just leaving. And she does.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A green, lush park. Megan, under a tree, sits on a colorf blanket watching KIDS play ball.

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Megan! Megan! Look! She turns. Davey, following Tom’s instructions, holds on tightly to a kite. The kite goes high and even higher. Davey, giddy, and Tom watch it go when a strong gust snap the kite out of Davey’s hands. Tom and Davey give chase. Megan looks on as Tom and Davey, further away now, run af the kite. A sharp pain cuts through her spine. She digs i her bag, finds the pills. She dry-swallows one, lies down the blanket, watching the blue sky above.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INT. MICHELLE’S FOSTER HOME - BEDROOM - DAY MICHELLE, 9, sits on the bottom bunk bed. She opens an envelope addressed to her: A $100 bill falls in her lap, then a note: “FROM DAVEY AND YOUR SISTER.” INT. TOM & MEGAN’S HOME - BEDROOM - DAY Tom sits on the bed, holding his head in his hands. Megan puts her arms around him.

dialogues.speaker: MEGAN
dialogues.text: You have to go.

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: Let’s not kid ourselves. As soon as they hear about Davey, I’m out of a job.

dialogues.speaker: MEGAN
dialogues.text: If you won’t testify, you’1l never know for sure.

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: I did the right thing.

dialogues.speaker: MEGAN
dialogues.text: Then tell them. I don’t want you to have any regrets. Not because of me. He turns to her and strokes her hair.

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: I won't.

dialogues.speaker: MEGAN
dialogues.text: I‘1l come with you.

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: No. You’re not well enough. And what about Davey? You can’t just leave him here.

dialogues.speaker: MEGAN
dialogues.text: He'll come with us. You’ve done so much for me. Let me do this. I want to.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom sits on one of the benches outside large double doors The doors open. Otis comes out. N.B. appears behind him. N.B. (to Tom) They're ready for you. Otis walks away. Tom calls after him.

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: Hey Otis! You gonna be the sexiest accountant in town. Otis can’t help but smile. Tom goes in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fluorescent lights and chairs. Tom’s in the hot seat acro from five ADMINISTRATORS from the National Transportation Safety Board and the Federal Railroad Administration. A f spectators speckle the room: Amtrak PERSONNEL, N.B.

dialogues.speaker: ADMINISTRATOR
dialogues.text: This is an unofficial hearing, Tom. The goal of these proceedings is strictly to determine whether an official investigation is required.

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: I understand.

dialogues.speaker: ADMINISTRATOR
dialogues.text: For the record, were you Senior Engineer on August eighth, the date of a fatal incident?

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: I was.

dialogues.speaker: ADMINISTRATOR
dialogues.text: Describe for us what happened that day to the best of your recollection...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A two-story, nondescript administrative building. Tom and Megan’s car is off to one side, at the end of the lot.

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: I wish I could go in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Megan, in the passenger seat, clutches her side. She turn Davey, who's in the back, and gives him a brave smile.

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: Why do we have to hide? Why can’t I just tell the social worker I want to stay with you?

dialogues.speaker: MEGAN
dialogues.text: It doesn’t work that way, Davey.

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: But why? She leans her head against the seat.

dialogues.speaker: MEGAN
dialogues.text: People like to follow rules. Us, keeping you, goes against that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom is still in the hot seat.

dialogues.speaker: ADMINISTRATOR
dialogues.text: What was your first reaction when you saw the car?

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: I went for the emergency brake.

dialogues.speaker: ADMINISTRATOR
dialogues.text: But you didn’t use it.

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: I decided not to. Nothing would have stopped that train on time - not even the emergency mode.

dialogues.speaker: ADMINISTRATOR
dialogues.text: Your partner thinks the impact might have been prevented.  95.

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: I disagree. At that speed, on a curve, we probably would have derailed.

dialogues.speaker: ADMINISTRATOR
dialogues.text: If you could do it all over again, would you do anything differently? Tom stares into space.

dialogues.speaker: ADMINISTRATOR
dialogues.text: Mr. Stark?

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: I can't do it all over again.

dialogues.speaker: ADMINISTRATOR
dialogues.text: But if you could. Tormented, he casts his head.

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: No. I wouldn't do anything differently.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom approaches. Davey jumps out of the car. He runs to hi

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: What did they say?

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: They're talking it over. Megan exits the car. Tom automatically checks her forehea

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: Are you feeling sick again?

dialogues.speaker: MEGAN
dialogues.text: I’m okay. She leans against the car, enjoying the sunlight, and smi at Tom.

dialogues.speaker: MEGAN
dialogues.text: You better get back.

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: Yes, yes.  96.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom marches down the hall. The doors open. Tom rushes toward the hearing room. The Administrators and the Amtrak personnel trickle out. few give Tom a courteous nod. N.B. approaches. Relieved, shakes Tom’s hand. N.B. No official investigation. You did everything by the book, my friend. (Tom nods; overcome with emotions) What’s wrong? I thought you'd be jumping up and down.

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: I‘1l see you later...Thanks. He hurries away. N.B. How’s Megan?

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: Everything's fine. He’s almost running now, out, toward the exit. N.B. Hang on! When are you coming back on the job? But Tom’s out the door. N.B. looks after him, puzzled.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Davey kneels by the car’s passenger side.

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: Megan...Megan... Tom runs over. He sees Megan passed-out on the car seat.

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: I didn’t do anything...She...She...

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: Get in the car.  97.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A sitting area with a television set. Tom, standing, look out the large, 8th floor windows. He turns to Davey. The boy's waiting next to him.

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: Megan is sick. She has cancer.

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: Can’t they cure her?

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: They did. Twice. It came back.

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: Can't they cure her again? They stand there in silence, digesting the painful truth.

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: Is Megan going to die? Tom can’t answer that one. Dr. Offenberger enters.

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: Can I see her?

dialogues.speaker: DR. OFFENBERGER
dialogues.text: Tom, she wants to go home. EXT. TOM & MEGAN’S HOME - DUSK Susan, in scrubs, waits in front of the house. Davey exits the car in the driveway. Tom carries Megan out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom carries Megan into the bedroom. Susan follows. Davey, in shock, goes into his room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Susan hooks Megan to an IV. Tom gives his wife a faint sm

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EXT. TOM & MEGAN’S HOME - NIGHT Tom walks Susan to her car.

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: Thanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom enters deeply sad. He opens the piano and touches one the keys. THUD!! It’s coming from upstairs. He rushes up. INT. DAVEY’S ROOM - NIGHT Davey, kneeling by his bed, smashes his head against the frame of the futon over and over again. Tom sees him and runs over. He holds him.

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: Stop! Stop! Davey, crying, his forehead bleeding, wriggles free and r to the door. Tom grabs him.

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: What are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: Let go!

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: Look at me. Look at me!

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: Nott! He tries to wriggle free. Tom won't let him.

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: I can’t be here! I can’t...I’m bad.

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: What did you do?

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: No! I’m bad.  99.

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: Davey, whatever it is...

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: I killed her. I killed her! I’m so sorry, Mom...I’m sorry.... He sobs, hysterical.

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: Easy, Davey. Take it--

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: I told the principal my mother was dead. I wanted to see the train...

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: You lied, is that what you did?

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: I knew she was sick. I saw her take the pills...God is punishing me. He knows everything...And now Megan's going to die too.

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: Megan's been sick for a long time. Before she ever met you.

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: I should have stopped her. Shouldn't have let her out of the house... I knew she was sick... I wanted to see the train.

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: It's alright.

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: We were on the tracks, I tried to pull her out. I tried real hard, but I couldn't... (talking to his mom) Mom, I couldn’t. I'm sorry. I couldn't. The train was coming and I jumped away and you...You died... (seeing Tom again) She died.

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: You did the right thing.  100.

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: nNoooo!!!

dialogues.speaker: TOM DAVEY
dialogues.text: Listen to me-- I should have--

dialogues.speaker: TOM DAVEY
dialogues.text: No. Should have--

dialogues.speaker: TOM DAVEY
dialogues.text: There was nothing-- But--

dialogues.speaker: TOM DAVEY
dialogues.text: Nothing you could have done. She was heavy, too heavy!

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: It wasn’t your fault.

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: Megan's dying.

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: Because she is sick.

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: God is punishing me.

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: It wasn’t your fault, Davey. Davey cries. Tom hugs him.

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: It isn’t your fault.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Megan watches Tom sleeping on a chair by her side. to look at Davey. He’s next to her in bed.

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: Please don’t die.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom puts breakfast on the table for him and Davey. his potatoes in ketchup. Davey follows suit. She turns He drowns  101.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Megan sleeps. Tom and Davey sit by her side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom watches as Susan checks Megan's IV.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom walks Susan to the door. She’s crying. Davey enters a sees her. She wipes her tears, goes to the boy and hugs h

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Davey eats at the table. Tom can’t touch his food.

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: Why don’t you go see Megan now? Davey rises and leaves. Tom, alone, weeps at the table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Megan’s eyes are tired, drowsy. Davey enters.

dialogues.speaker: MEGAN
dialogues.text: Come sit by me. He does.

dialogues.speaker: MEGAN
dialogues.text: I wish we had more time. I’d like to take care of you for just a little while longer.

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: If you think hard about it, you could stay.

dialogues.speaker: MEGAN
dialogues.text: I love you, Davey. And I will stay with you. (pointing to his chest) Here. She hugs him with the little strength she has left in her body. Tom stands in the doorway. Megan and Davey see him.  102.

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: I love you too, Megan. He leaves. Tom enters, sits by her side and takes her hand.

dialogues.speaker: MEGAN
dialogues.text: Promise me.

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: Anything.

dialogues.speaker: MEGAN
dialogues.text: Fight for him. He’s so much like you. Promise.

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: Whatever you want.

dialogues.speaker: MEGAN
dialogues.text: Promise...

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: I promise. He buries his face in her chest. She smiles. EXT. TOM & MEGAN’S HOME - NIGHT Davey sits outside watching the stars, trying to make his peace with God.

dialogues.text: Sunrays dry the morning dew from the impatiens.

dialogues.text: Tom opens his eyes. Megan’s eyes are closed. He puts his head to her chest. She’s not breathing.

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: Oh, God. Megan... He rises and stares at her lifeless body.

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: Oh, no... Not my girl. Not my Meggie.  103. Davey enters. Tom tries to pull himself together.

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: She’s gone. Davey shakes his head. Tom goes to him and hugs him. Dave cries on his chest. They cry together.

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: All set?

dialogues.speaker: DAVEY
dialogues.text: Yes. Tom turns off the light and lies down next to Davey.

dialogues.text: It’s drizzling. Summer is almost over. Tom pulls into one spot. INT. TOM’S CAR - DAY Tom shuts the engine and turns to Davey. He gives hima reassuring look, smiles. The boy nods.
